results.title: Starstruck [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Palm Beach Pictures, David Elfick, Richard Brennan and Gillian Armstrong
results.brief_description: A comic musical set in Sydney against the background of a new wave of Australian music in the early 1980s. A reluctant barmaid in her family’s hotel, Jackie (Jo Kennedy) wants to be a singing star and is assisted by her eccentric 14 year old cousin, willing to manipulate the media to make his cousin famous. Cast includes Ross O’Donovan, Max Cullen and Margo Lee. Original music by “The Swingers” and “Mental As Anything”.

results.title: Starstruck
results.creator_credit: Highgate Pictures, Patrick McCormick and Claude Kerven
results.brief_description: Depicts the conflicts faced by an adolescent girl who must choose between her dream to be a singer-song writer or living up to her mother’s hopes by following a secure but not totally satisfying career as a bookkeeper. This film would be useful for discussion of values, decision making and communication. Cast includes Trini Alvarado, Joanna Merlin. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Starship troopers
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Tri-Star Pictures, Alan Marshall, Jon Davison and Paul Verhoeven
results.brief_description: Presented as an enthusiastic, squeaky clean propaganda/soap opera style film, this highly satirical work from director Paul Verhoeven is an effective political comment on militaristic and colonialistic driven societies. Johnny Rico (Casper Van Dien) and his unquestioningly patriotic friends; recent graduates of the Buenos Aires High School, join the Federation forces in a mission to the home planet of an alien bug race that threatens life on earth. What follows is an amazing epic science fiction adventure complete with love triangle, mock news flashes, schlock battle sequences and seamless special effects as the all too mannequin-like characters attempt to overcome their vicious bug enemies. Cast includes Casper Van Dien, Denise Richards, Jake Busey, Neil Patrick Harris, Patrick Muldoon and Michael Ironside. Based on the book by Robert A. Heinlein.

results.title: Stars of the Russian ballet
results.brief_description: Sovexportfilm Australia presents this historic feature length production made in 1953 and beautifully preserved. It is a compilation of three ballets, featuring both world famous Kirov and Bolshoi Ballets. The first of the three ballets is Tchaikovsky’s “Swan Lake” with Galina Ulanova as the beautiful White Swan - Odette, and the outstanding Natalya Dudinskaya as the rivalling Black Swan - Odile. The second ballet is “The Fountains of Bakchisarai” based on the poem by Alexander Pushkin and starring the internationally acclaimed Maya Plisetskaya as the seductive Zarema and Galina Ulanova as the tragic Maria. The final ballet is “The Flames of Paris” the breathtaking tale of the French Revolution, with magnificent sets and costumes and one of the largest casts ever assembled for a ballet.

results.title: Stars in his eyes
results.brief_description: Marianne Guetta knows when her husband John tells her he has a plan, he’s thinking big! Over the years he helped organize the Sunbury rock festival, was the lighting director for channel nine on various major telecasts and is now planning to build an observatory and planetarium.

holdings.name: MPEG-4 Digital File; ACMI Digital Access Copy - overscan

results.title: Stars and stripes
results.brief_description: An experiment in film animation in which “stars” and “stripes” perform acrobatics to the tune of the John Philip Sousa’s march. Rippling stripes and gay sparkling stars jump and undulate, dash about the screen, and break into effects suggesting a fireworks display. Sometimes part of a stripe pursues a star. Finally the stars become flashing meteors and burst in light and colour. The film was made without a camera, by Norman McLaren drawing and colouring directly on film.

results.title: Stars and galaxies (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Educational Media International and Ken J. Widdowson
results.brief_description: World renowned star photographer David Maitland of the Anglo-Australian Observatory, along with others reveal the universe in brilliant colour. The evolution of a star in a gaseous nebulae through to the final stages of its life as a white dwarf, supernova, pulsar or black hole. Additional sequences trace the history of astronomy and the development of optical and radio telescopes. This CD provides excellent information for teaching about Astronomy in the classroom.

results.title: Starman
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Larry Franco and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: An alien (Jeff Bridges) makes a stopover on earth when he encounters the Voyager 2 probe. By masquerading as a human he has the opportunity, if only for a little while, to live like an ordinary man. His arrival is quickly discovered by a young woman (Karen Allen) who develops feelings for the Starman and agrees to assist him in the 2000 mile journey it will take him to get home. Cast includes Charles Martin Smith and Richard Jaeckel.

results.title: Starlife (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Traces the long evolution of a star from its birth in the depths of black nebula to its final extinction. Based on photographs taken with highly sophisticated instruments, animated drawings which propel the audience through the vast spaces of the universe, and bombard the eye with extra-terrestrial imagery of great beauty.

results.title: Starlife
results.brief_description: Traces the long evolution of a star from its birth in the depths of the black nebula to its final extinction. Based on photographs taken with highly sophisticated instruments, animated drawings which propel the audience through the vast spaces of the universe, and bombard the eye with extra terrestrial imagery of great beauty. To illustrate the different evolutionary paths followed by stars of different masses, a variety of stars is studied. The film also details the process of nucleosynthesis and explains red giants, “bursters”, the warping of spacetime and the mysterious “black hole.”
